business.headline: Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

Sensex gains 700 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatility todayStock market rebound: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 730.39 points to 82,020.35, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 192.70 points to 24,741.40, as of 3 PM.

Mobikwik IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut amid heavy demand?Mobikwik IPO has seen very strong demand among investors and was fully booked within the first hour of opening for subscription.
Sensex back in green: Airtel, HUL, and IT stocks lead market rebound As of 12:52 PM, Sensex was up by 111.46 points to 81,401.42, while Nifty50 gained 12.75 points to 24,561.45.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO last day: Check gmp, subscription. Shoud you subscribe?Vishal Mega Mart IPO has set a price range of Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share. Retail investors need to purchase a minimum of 190 shares in a single lot, requiring an initial investment of Rs 14,820.
Azim Premji, Ranjan Pai to buy a minority stake in Akasa Air: ReportAzim Premji and Ranjan Pai family offices acquired a minority stake in Akasa Air as part of a $130-140 million fundraising round.
Explained: Why a credit score over 800 mattersHigh credit scores boost financial health by offering cheaper loans, and better insurance discounts, amongst others.

Gold, silver price today, December 13, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today December 13, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Key factors behind stock market weaknessStock market crash: As of 10:37 AM, the Sensex was down 1,064.37 points to 80,225.59, while Nifty was also struggling below 24,300 losing 332.10 points to 24,216.60.
Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade; inflation relief fails to lift market moodThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 540.09 points to 80,749.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 160.35 points to 24,388.35.

Mahila Samman Yojana: Key details about Rs 1000 schemeThe AAP government announced Mahila Samman Yojana, offering Rs 1000 monthly to women in Delhi, with a rise to Rs 2100 if it wins in the upcoming elections.

Retail inflation cools to 5.48% in November from 6.21% in OctoberHouseholds across the world's most populous country are likely to welcome the inflation relief, given that food expenses dominate many family budgets.
Sensex, Nifty end lower ahead of inflation data; bearish trend persistsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 236.18 points to close at 81,289.96, while the Nifty50 was down 93.10 points to end at 24,548.70.
December 15 advance tax deadline: What you need to knowTaxpayers with liabilities exceeding Rs 10,000 are required to make quarterly advance tax payments to avoid penalties and interest charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: AAP releases final list for polls, Arvind Kejriwal to contest from New DelhiThe Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has released its fourth and final list of 38 candidates for the Delhi Assembly elections. Arvind Kejriwal will contest from the New Delhi constituency.

Mahayuti cabinet's swearing in at 4 pm, Shinde Sena to get additional portfolioOut of its 20 cabinet berths, the BJP is likely to leave some vacant as some new faces are expected to be inducted into the state cabinet. The Shiv Sena is also likely to induct some new faces, while some ministers from the previous Mahayuti government are likely to be dropped by Eknath Shinde's faction.

'Is my grandson alive?' Techie Atul Subhash's father after wife Nikita's arrestThe family of techie Atul Subhash, who died by suicide in Bengaluru, is expressing deep concern for the whereabouts of his 4-year-old son after his wife and family members were arrested.

Auction LIVE: Giants sign Dottin and Simran, MI rope in 16-year-old KamaliniWPL 2025 Auction Live Updates: Gujarat Giants signed Deandra Dottin for Rs 1.70 crore and Simran Shaikh for Rs 1.9 crore, while Mumbai Indians bought uncapped 16-year-old G. Kamalini for Rs 1.6 crore. Delhi Capitals, meanwhile, signed Nandini Kashyap for just Rs 10 lakh.

Karan Aujla, who wrote Diljit's GOAT in 10 minutes, got poetry from painKaran Aujla, a prolific songwriter, channelled his pain into music, crafting songs that resonate globally. Though the world has just discovered him, the 27-year-old Aujla has been working in the shadows for a decade now, collaborating with artists like Jassie Gill and Diljit Dosanjh. This is what makes him a rare phenomenon.

Atishi writes to Amit Shah on Rohingyas, cites 'Operation Illegals' reportAtishi, in her letter, not only questioned the Centre's border security measures but also accused the BJP-led government of resettling Rohingyas in Delhi, thus taking away resources meant for its residents.

Travis Head explains his sensational batting record vs India after Gabba 152 Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Australia opener Travis Head credited his familiarity with India for his exceptional record, after a stunning 152 off 160 balls on Day 2 of the third Test at Gabba.

Gujarat woman, in love with cousin, gets husband killed 4 days after weddingPolice found that the woman, Payal, had plotted her husband Bhavik's murder along with her cousin Kalpesh, who she was in love with before marriage.
Elon Musk's Tesla robot learns to 'stumble like human' in viral videoTesla's Optimus robot stumbled its way into the spotlight, attempting to walk on a slope in a video that left the internet amazed.

Trinamool leader says 'Muslims can be bigger than majority', BJP fires backTrinamool Congress leader Firhad Hakim, who is also Kolkata Mayor, said that Muslims in India do not see themselves as a minority, and will hopefully become bigger than the majority one day.

Ravi Shastri questions other Indian bowlers after Bumrah picks 5-wicket haul Ravi Shastri questioned if the rest of the Indian bowling could execute their plans properly after Jasprit Bumrah waged a lone battle on Day 2 of the Gabba Test. While the rest of the bowling lineup failed, Bumrah picked up his 2nd 5-wicket haul of the series.

Lok Sabha to delay One Nation, One Election bills; focus on financial businessThe two bills -- Constitution (129th Amendment) Bill and the Union Territories Laws (Amendment) Bill were earlier scheduled for introduction on Monday (December 16), as per the initial list of business released on Friday.

He's running nation on 3 hours of sleep: Saif Ali Khan's praise for PM ModiActor Saif Ali Khan described his "special" meeting with PM Modi, sharing details of their conversation and the warmth the PM showed despite his busy schedule, as the Kapoor family invited him to the Raj Kapoor Film Festival.

As winter session washout looms, how BJP MPs have Opposition on backfootSo sharp has been the 'George Soros' offensive that the treasury benches kept the Congress-led Opposition cornered for the whole past week in Parliament

Gabba Test: Head, Smith give India WTC Final flashback despite Bumrah heroicsBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Travis Head continued to torment India while Steve Smith returned to form as the Australian duo served a flashback of the World Test Championship 2023 final to India on Day 2 of the Brisbane Test. Jasprit Bumrah was India's only bright spot on a dull day on the field.
Watch: Allu Arjun meets Chiranjeevi after release from jail Actor Allu Arjun met Tollywood megastar Chiranjeevi on Sunday, and several glimpses of their meeting have since gone viral on social media.

After Kylaq, another compact SUV is coming. More problems for Brezza?The compact SUV segment is dominated by the likes of the Brezza, Nexon, Venue and XUV 3XO. The Kylaq has also entered this space. A new SUV is coming on December 19. We check out its details.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Techie Atul Subhash's wife, in-laws arrested in suicide abetment caseTechie Atul Subhash's wife, Nikita Singhania, was arrested in Gurugram, while her mother and brother were detained in Prayagraj. The arrests come after the Bengaluru City Police filed a case of abetment to suicide against them.

Dr Naresh Trehan recommends cutting out these 4 'whites' from your dietDr Naresh Trehan, Chairman of Medanta Hospital, highlighted the importance of a balanced lifestyle for longevity, advocating moderation in diet and regular exercise for heart health.

How to keep romance alive after marriage, if you live with familyMarriage counselors say that finding privacy and keeping romance alive is a common challenge for Indian couples living with their families. However, it is certainly possible to keep the spark alive.

What distinguishes Ram from Ravan, actor Varun Dhawan asked. Amit Shah said…Actor Varun Dhawan praised Amit Shah as the 'Hanuman of the country' for his selfless service and commended the clarity of his answer to his question about the difference between Ram and Ravan.

One man army Bumrah: Fans on pacer's five-wicket haul in Brisbane Test vs AUSJasprit Bumrah's stunning five-wicket haul on Day 2 of the Brisbane Test kept India in the game, but the lack of support from other bowlers sparked concerns about India's over-reliance on their star pacer.

Amit Shah's pitch for One Nation One Election in first interview since 2024 winUnion Home Minister, in his first media interaction after the BJP's win in Lok Sabha polls, dismissed allegations that the 'One Nation One Election' bill undermines the principles of federalism.

Salman Khan celebrates nephew Nirvaan's birthday, Suhana, Bobby Deol joinSohail Khan and Seema Sajdeh's son, Nirvaan Khan, celebrated his 24th birthday on Saturday. The star-studded celebration was attended by Salman Khan, Suhana Khan, Malaika Arora, Fardeen Khan, and several others.

Watch: Govinda, Sushmita Sen get nostalgic at Anees Bazmee's Mumbai eventSushmita Sen and Govinda reunited at Anees Bazmee's 45-year celebration in Mumbai. The duo recreated a pose from Do Knot Disturb and were joined by other Bollywood stars at the star-studded event.
Anushka Shetty's Ghaati to release in theatres in April 2025Anushka Shetty's highly-anticipated film Ghaati will release in April 2025. The action crime-drama is directed by Krish Jagarlamudi.

Inside Ankita Lokhande and Vicky Jain's dreamy anniversary celebrationAnkita Lokhande marked her third wedding anniversary with Vicky Jain by sharing heartfelt photos and messages on social media. The couple got married in December 2021.

Lewis Hamilton bids emotional goodbye to Mercedes headquarters in BrackleyLewis Hamilton bid an emotional farewell to Mercedes, thanking the Brackley and Brixworth teams for their support, as he prepared for his highly anticipated move to Ferrari. The farewell marked the end of a legendary era at Mercedes.

Should have attacked Travis Head with Jasprit Bumrah early: Harbhajan SinghHarbhajan Singh and Matthew Hayden were critical of India's tactics against Travis Head as the Australia batter scored his second consecutive hundred of the series on Sunday, December 15. Harbhajan felt that India should have attacked with Jasprit Bumrah early on.

Bumrah is expected to take a wicket every time: Shastri highlights lack of supportRavi Shastri highlighted how Jasprit Bumrah has been carrying the immense pressure of leading India's bowling attack, especially on Day 2 of the Brisbane Test, where Australia gained momentum despite the pacer's early brilliance.

This was Head's second consecutive hundred in the series after his Adelaide heroics.

AUS vs IND: Why are Stormtroopers in attendance at the Gabba Test?The GabbaTroopers, dressed as Star Wars Stormtroopers, lit up the Brisbane Test between India and Australia, blending cricket with cinematic excitement. Their presence, music tributes, and seven-year celebration added a playful edge to the heated on-field drama.

World Champion D Gukesh reveals mother's simple message that became his mantraD Gukesh revealed the simple message from his mother that has become his mantra in life. Gukesh created history when he defeated Ding Liren to be crowned as the youngest Chess World Champion in history.

AUS vs IND: Mohammed Siraj survives injury scare on Day 2 in BrisbaneIndia fast bowler Mohammed Siraj survived an injury scare on Day 2 of the third Test against Australia at the Gabba in Brisbane. Siraj left the field midway in his over and returned to the pavilion.

Steve Smith nowhere near his best: Vaughan, Border on batter's knock in BrisbaneMichael Vaughan and Allan Border were left unimpressed by Steve Smith's knock so far on Day 2 of the Brisbane Test. Smith survived a couple of close calls on Sunday, December 15 and has looked unconvincing in his innings.

Siraj's bail switch works? Hayden slams Labuschagne for losing focus at GabbaMatthew Hayden criticised Marnus Labuschagne for overreacting to Mohammed Siraj's playful antics during Day 2 of the Brisbane Test, calling the reaction unnecessary. Labuschagne's dismissal shortly after further intensified the heated exchanges between India and Australia.

Mohammed Siraj booed: Gavaskar calls out double standards of Australia 'saints'Sunil Gavaskar has slammed the double standards of the Australian cricketers and fans for their portrayal of Mohammed Siraj after his altercation with Travis Head during the Gabba Test. Siraj has been booed ever since his feud with Head.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
